replies.body: The rework made Darius feels a bit too weak now. His q damage mostly comes from hitting the enemy with the shaft, but with the charge up it's obvious for anyone with a brain to move away unless you are right in front of him.  His passive is kinda useless against smart players that know not to do long trades with him. To sum it up Darius stomps anyone that doesn't understand his abilities and vice versa.

You're supposed to Q first, then Hook, then W Autoattack in between when you can.
Don't lead with the hook, you whittle the laner down with Qs then hook them in and ult.

I've never played Darius but the one way you can land your (now delayed) Q is to wait for your enemy laner to cs one of your minions, land it in a way that you don't hit too much of his minions with the blade as well as hitting him with the blade.
The fact that Darius has a 10% heal off of his missing health means being low isn't really that much of a problem when you can just sustain with it. 

He's way better, you actually have to think a little bit more than just spaz on your keyboard; how old Darius played. 
This weakness in the late is a trade-off for strength in the mid to late game where you can actually be useful with your sustain with Q. Dead Man's Plate lets you catch people quite quickly.

They are buffing his damage on Q to make up for the fact that its harder to hit. Doubled the base Damage level 1 on PBE. He also has his attack speed growth per level doubled.

You are right in the fact he doesn't feel like Darius. The guy that used to Q+E+W+Q+R and insta someone. Riot changed him so that if you don't build almost full-tank he dies before getting his damage off.

He is no longer the awesome lane bully level 2 all-inner that only Tryndamere/Riven can match. He's more of a sustain laner now (with the Q heal) and the potential to burst once you are low.

I think people just have to find a nice build for him and he needs a minor buffs to get him to a good place.
